body.p: О трех вещах по сегоднишним вестям сомнения нет: 1) что дело было между нашим флотом и шведским; 2) что дело решилось в нашу пользу, ибо Чичагов не пошел починиваться в Копенгаген; 3) что адмирал соединился с Козляниновым, ибо послал ему сказать, чтоб шел, и сей пошел действительно; о сем прислан курьер из Копенгагена, а от адмирала нет еще ничего.The editors of the original edition date this letter to 6 July 1789, citing the diary of Catherine's secretary A.V. Khrapovitsky. But the diary entry for 6 July concerns a meeting between the Prince of Nassau and the commander of Russian forces on land, Musin-Pushkin. The entry of 4 July concerns news from Chichagov about an attack on Kozlyaninov. The diary in fact indicates that the present letter must date from 6 August 1789: on that date, Khrapovitsky noted, 'По сказкам корабельщиков торговых судов, 21 Июля должно быть сражение у Чичагова с Шведами, и что через 3 дня после того, соединясь с Козляиновым [sic], он возвратился, ибо видели уже одни датские корабли на рейде; усумнились, что нет рапорта' ('According to what the merchant captains are saying, there must have been a battle on 21 July between Chichagov and the Swedes. 3 days afterward he met Kozlyainov [sic] and returned, for they saw only Danish ships in the roadstead. [Catherine] worried that she has not yet received a report') (Dnevnik A.V. Khrapovitskago, pp. 295, 301-302). The supposition of a battle, the meeting between Chichagov and Kozlyaninov, and the absence of a report from Chichagov all seem to confirm the match between this letter and Khrapovitsky's account of Catherine's preoccupations on 3 August. The battle turned out to be the Battle of Öland.

Judging by today's news, there is no doubt about three things: 1) that there was a battle between our navy and the Swedish one; 2) that the battle ended in our favour, for Chichagov did not go to Copenhagen for repairs; 3) that the admiral joined up with Kozlyaninov, for he sent to tell him to go, and he indeed went. A courier was sent from Copenhagen about this, but there is nothing yet from the admiral.
